name: BayPass
label: baypass
shortDescription: Genome-Wide Scan for Adaptive Differentiation and Association Analysis with population-specific covariables.
longDescription:
BayPass is a population genomics software which is primarily
aimed at identifying genetic markers subjected to selection and/or associated
to population-specific covariates (e.g., environmental variables, quantitative or categorical phenotypic characteristics).

details.label: genotyping file name
details.description: This option (mandatory) gives the name of the genotyping input file.

details.label: covariates file name
details.description: This option gives the name of the covariate input file.

details.label: pool size file name
details.description:
This option gives the name of the input file containing the haploid sam-
ple size of each population.

details.label: npop
details.description: This option (mandatory) gives the number of population considered in the data set (half the number of column in the genotype data file).

details.label: scale covariates
details.description: This option allows to perform scaling of each covariable in the covariate input file

details.label: prefix for output file name
details.description: This option allows to add a prefix to all the output files.
